physics_set_friction.htm+html.head.title: physics_set_friction.htm+html.body.p:87-3
physics_set_friction: When you bind a fixture to an instance using physics_fixture_bind() this returns an "id" for the bound fixture. You can use this id to set the friction value of the bound fixture, not the "base" fixture, at any time using this function. Note that the friction is usually set to a value between 0 and 1, but you can use any non-negative value if required.

physics_set_friction.htm+html.head.title: physics_set_friction.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:99-9
physics_set_friction: the id of the bound fixture

physics_set_friction.htm+html.head.title: physics_set_friction.htm+html.body.table.tbody.tr.td:103-9
physics_set_friction: the new friction value to apply

physics_set_friction.htm+html.head.title: physics_set_friction.htm+html.body.p:113-3
physics_set_friction: The code above gets the current friction value for the bound physics properties of the instance and then sets them to a different value.
